children.text: The particleboard flooring material used for the balcony floor substrate is not an appropriate material, which may result in moisture damage from condensation, and eventually leaking.
Part 3.8.1.3 - External above ground membranes of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia requires that
‘Waterproofing membranes for external above ground use must comply with AS 4654.1 and AS 4654.2’
, and the relevant Australian Standard AS 4654.2 Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use in Clause 2.5 - Substrate states that
‘Particleboard sheeting shall not be used as a substrate for external waterproofing systems’ .
This balcony floor will need to be removed and replaced with a substrate that is suitable for use, and then be properly waterproofed in accordance with the BCA and AS 4654.
